articles.description: It was 1951 that a Japanese researcher found a two dimensional lattice structure that could lock electrons. It has taken over seven decades to find a 3D structure.
articles.content: Using an experimental technique called angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy (ARPES), the researchers could determine the alloy's detailed band structure. They found it to be flat in several ways… [+1136 chars]

articles.title: China's Chang'e-7 moon mission to target Shackleton crater - SpaceNews
articles.description: China’s Chang’e-7 moon mission to target Shackleton crater China will attempt to land on the illuminated rim of Shackleton crater near the lunar south pole with its 2026 Chang’e-7 mission.
articles.content:
HELSINKI China will attempt to land on the illuminated rim of Shackleton crater near the lunar south pole with its 2026 Change-7 mission.
